intro: Chloraea reflexa var. latifolia, commonly known as the broadleaf chloraea, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the family Rutaceae and is characterized by its broad, lance-shaped leaves. The plant produces small, fragrant white flowers that are typically clustered in racemes. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in rainforests. Its ornamental value makes it a popular choice for garden cultivation in suitable climates.
